reviews.review: Jogo lindo uma Obra-prima,jogabilidade Ã³tima,grÃ¡ficos lindos e historia 10/10 JOGUEM S2

Primero que nada es un JUEGAZO y tenes que jugarlo si o si.
Durante toda la partida estuve inmerso en el juego, tiene un escenario excelente, narrativa preciosa y ni hablar del arte que maneja, es increible como hasta con los graficos mas bajos el juego puede sorprenderte de lo bien que se ve y tambien de lo fantastico que se siente, todo por esa banda sonora que al escucharla te hace erizar completamente la piel.
Es una joya de las que ya casi no hay, un juego que se merece estar en las bibliotecas de todos.
Y tampoco es tan necesario saber la historia de los dos anteriores BioShock para poder comprender la suya, ya que este transcurre aÃ±os atras y de por si tiene su propio lore. 
En fin, es un juegazo y tenes que comprarlo, y mas cuando esta de oferta porque te trae toda la coleccion de BioShock.
10/10

one of the best BioShock games.

Overall: 7/10, Interesting story, average firefight.

My 3rd Bioshock experience, so expected some twist at the end. Still a nice written story.
A bit disappointed about the gameplay, the fighting is rather clunky, some vigors are useless.
Bioshock 2 is better & more fun.
Enemies are too dumb, even at the hardest. I guess this game is more about the story.

Visual is beautiful though, the best visualisation between the 3. There's a lot to be enjoyed, if ur gpu is capable.

Is good game. Spend good time. But seriously i'm doing my third or fourth play through now and i still love it. This time on 1999 mode. It's a great story, has great gameplay, and is totally worth your money.

ItÂ´s not without a reason, why Bioshock Infinite is my fav. videogame. A flashing story, interesting characters and a diversified combat-system. The first videogame I got all achievements.

This is a mixed bag for me. On one hand the gameplay has been streamlined and improved. The abilities and gunplay is better than the previous games.  But although the scenery is still spectacular I really miss the city under the sea. Its quite different than bioshock 1 and 2 and I dont know how to feel about the radical change. It is a good game but it doesnt feel like the other two bioshocks.  Regardless it is a game worth having in your library.

This game makes me feel engaged because of its wonderful story and gameplay. 10/10
Me enamore de esta trilogÃ­a, y este me gusto mucho. con la historia principal te quedas pendej0 de tanto desmadre, y con el contenido extra te quedas con cara de, aaa su put4 madr3

Bioshock: Infinite took a different approach on world design, and I think it's amazing. Forget derelict claustrophobic broken underwater tunnels, infested with deranged psychopaths - what you'll find here is a game world that is much brighter, sunnier, cozier with large open areas. There's still a million enemies hunting you, but at least not every NPC you meet wants your head, which is refreshing. Plus, you get a companion who loots for various items and throws them at you when you need them the most - ammo, medkits, even cash. No longer are you all on your own, and that immediately makes the atmosphere better and friendlier. 

Bioshock: Infinite also brings some other good bits, such as very cool new mechanics, while the old ones have undergone an overhaul which simply makes the game easy to enjoy. The whole shooting flows so much better than it ever did in the previous installments, making this a very smooth and polished FPS. Another thing that pleasantly surprised me was that the player (you) can talk! I hate when they make the player mute, as it usually makes no sense, so I'm glad they voiced him. As for the story, it's deep, messed up and sometimes hard to follow, but it's not bad and in my opinion has some very cool twists. I liked it the most from the whole series.

All in all, when I played Bioshock 1 and 2 I thought they were too much, too all over the place, and I didn't really like them. Infinite, on the other hand, was a very pleasant FPS experience that delivered on all fronts. It's way more modern and easier to grasp, so I recommend to give this a shot.
Great game, masterpiece- left me in ruins.

Creo que de los tres juegos, este es el visualmente mas atractivo y cÃ³modo de jugar, simplemente por que los escenarios estÃ¡n hechos de una forma mas libre y da esa sensaciÃ³n de estar en un mundo abierto, en cuestiÃ³n de la historia creo que la mayor diferencia es que mientras que cuando llegas a Rapture la ciudad ya fue destruida, en Columbia apenas se esta llevando el conflicto que la harÃ¡ caer. 
Me gustÃ³ el detalle de poder participar en la guerra, aunque la historia base, de no ser por el tema de los desgarres en el espacio-tiempo creo que seria la misma que la de Rapture pero con ligeras diferencias.

Replayed this game for the first time in probably 4 years. Used to think of it as the weakest Bioshock, but after replaying it, I think my opinion has done a 180. This is by far one of the best games I have played. The environment is amazing, and getting to explore it before everything goes to chaos is the best. Ending is great as well, and while replaying it you can see all the signs that point to the ending.

El juego decide hacer ciertas mejores en la jugabilidad con respecto a los primeros dos. Logra crear una experiencia que goza de una ambientaciÃ³n muy detallada, con un apartado artÃ­stico maravilloso (aunque a veces la luz es demasiado brillante y satura). Se agradece el hecho de que haya solo un final pues anteriormente (al menos en el primer bioshock) estos daban un alto Ã©nfasis en decisiones que nada tenÃ­an que ver con el resto de la experiencia. Sin embargo aquÃ­ siendo solo ese Ãºnico desenlace logra ser medianamente creÃ­ble o, por lo menos entendible y da sentido a ciertos eventos de la historia (el hecho de porquÃ© Booker inicia su viaje de manera tan vaga al inicio).
Tiene el aÃ±adido de contar con una inteligencia artificial que logra ser un apoyo real durante las batallas mÃ¡s frenÃ©ticas, aunque es cierto que esta es mÃ¡s bien estÃ©tica pues los enemigos jamÃ¡s le harÃ¡n daÃ±o ni mucho menos la verÃ¡n cuando estÃ© presente. Hablando de eso, comete el mismo error de la saga que es llenar los escenarios de enemigos (que aquÃ­ puede ser un poco mÃ¡s justificable siendo que no estÃ¡n buscando) a tal punto que se siente artificial, sabiendo que siempre tendremos momentos tranquilos y otros llenos de enemigos que terminan siendo repetitivos y no permiten disfrutar del escenario en el que estamos.
"Bioshock: infinite" no es perfecto ni estÃ¡ cerca de estarlo, pero es una grata experiencia de jugar, mejor algunos aspectos de los anteriores tÃ­tulos, pero tambiÃ©n empeora en otros o directamente los deja iguales.
Con respecto a los DLC, estos aportan ligeramente a las historias, siendo el protagonizado por Elizabeth el que mÃ¡s agrega y  destaca al cambiar drÃ¡sticamente el esquema de juego para volverse mÃ¡s coherente con su protagonista y los escenarios que visitamos, haciendo que seamos vulnerables, pero no inÃºtiles.
Una joyita en toda la expresiÃ³n de la palabra.

What an amazing game! Even after seven years this game still holds up. The combat is dynamic and fun and the story is the chef's kiss. The save feature is a little weird but doesn't hinder the game-play. 9/10, would play again.
Finds a way to not be melodramatic, a feat very few games accomplish. Play it and enjoy.
this game is too smart for my dumb little peanut brain to comprehend.

Con bioshock infinite tengo sentimientos encontrados, quiero decir este juego tiene una de las historia mas hermosa de todas y ahora. ya no estamos en raptur si no en columbia sinceramente no me gusto mucho la ambientacion, estaba demasiado acostumbrado a raptur y su ambiente depresivo y caÃ³tico. y como que aquÃ­ hay mucha mas acciÃ³n que los otros quiero decir que hay demasiada holeadas de enemigos tantas, que en los anteriores bioshock no pasaba el final sinceramente es hermoso y cuando sacaron el dlc para volver a rapture. a conocer a la leyenda de jack dios mio que hermoso juego parece una obra de arte de tan bueno que es 10/10

The ending made me fuxking double jump and shidd my pancreas onto my hardwood floor

Las Mecanicas  son una fusion entre el estilo del propio bioshock y  un  estilo FPS "clasico" , donde se puede notar ese cobertura y disparo, dando paso a  que  ciertas zonas posiblemente sean muy cansadoras ,al  matar tantos enemigos porque si. 
Dejado de lado esto ultimo,  descubriras una historia que viene a coronar y completar una saga tan iconica como lo es  Bioshock  , lleno de accion , ciencia ficcion , ambientes inmersivos , con personajes dignos de estar en algun top de los mejores de la historia como lo son Elizabeth y los hermanos Lutece.
En resumen si te gusto el uno y, compra este sin pensarlo .

False shepherd took the girl to wipe away his debt.
On his way he found his lost kid 
And a singing bird.
Tremendo juegaso, recomendasisimo, tematica diferente a las entregas posteriores, pero superable y buenaso

Definitely one of my favorite ones, if there will be a another part of the series, I would buy it no matter what price!

One of the best stories. I didn't expect the game to be like this but I certainly did enjoy it. The game play was great, a major difference than the other 2 Bioshock games but it was still enjoyable! The enemies were a lot easier, just that a lot of times they usually attacked in groups. It was, dare I say, cute in the beginning. I thought it was going to be centered around a world like the one Elsa and Anna lives in until people started attacking me. You should take the time and explore the game and pay attention to the little things in the game because it does look gorgeous. The characters were nicely done, they were interesting. It all makes sense in the end.

i beat the game and idk wth even happened

This game is amazing. I love it so much!

The gameplay is great fun, the story is amazing, Columbia is beautiful and there is so much more to love about this game.

There were however a couple things that I didn't like about it. These are things that it copies from other modern shooters that weren't in the original 2 Bioshock games. I'm talking about there only being checkpoints and no manual saves, only being able to carry 2 weapons and semi-regenerating health (didn't really mind this one, but I thought I'd just mention it here). These are things that I really dislike and I don't get why game companies feel the need to put these things in their games, it just makes the game worse in my opinion. But, These were all things that I could deal with and didn't ruin the experience for me.

Another thing I want to mention is the ending. I wont get into spoilers but I do wanna talk about it for a little bit. I thought this game's ending was jaw-dropping, it was such a great ending in my opinion. There are some people who don't really like it, that's their opinion and that's fine. It is definitely a pretty confusing and complicated story overall, so I understand why someone wouldn't like it.

This game was amazing and I would very highly recommend it.
